publisher.publisher-name: Military Operations Research Society in cooperation with the Military Applications Society (MAS) of the Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS)

title-group.subtitle: Using Latent Class Analysis with Survey Data

bio.p: MAJ Cardy Moten III is an active duty army logistics officer in the functional area FA 49 Operations Research/Systems Analyst (ORSA). He is currently serving as a combat analyst for the TRADOC Analysis Center—Monterey (TRAC-MTRY). He holds an MS in operations research from the Naval Postgraduate School and a bachelor’s degree in personal finance from Liberty University. His previous assignments included multiple combat rotations to Iraq and Afghanistan supporting the 160th Special Operations Aviation Regiment (Airborne) and the 4th Brigade, 101st Airborne Division (Air Assault).

LTC Christopher M. Smith is an active duty army operations research/systems analyst officer and currently the director of the TRADOC Analysis Center—Monterey (TRAC-MTRY). He completed this work as part of his dissertation work at the University of Virginia in the Department of Systems and Information Engineering. He has taught in the Department of Mathematical Sciences at West Point and served overseas in a combat tour as an artilleryman during Operation Iraqi Freedom 1. He has a master’s degree in operations research from the University of Texas, Austin, a master’s degree in engineering management from the Missouri University of Science and Technology, and an undergraduate degree in systems engineering from West Point. His current research focuses on applying systems engineering methodologies to the problems of the intelligence community.
